thread.section_title: Science News and Analysis - Wall Street Journal
thread.title: John Nasseff Started on Loading Dock and Made a Fortune at West Publishing

author: James R. Hagerty
title: John Nasseff Started on Loading Dock and Made a Fortune at West Publishing
text:
John Nasseff didn’t know his place. He was a ninth-grade dropout and had been hired shortly after World War II to unload rolls of printing paper from boxcars in St. Paul, Minn. Within weeks, the son of poor Lebanese immigrants was pestering his bosses about how the job could be done more efficiently.
Over time, his employer, West Publishing Co., a publisher of legal information, began to rely more on Mr. Nasseff’s mechanical and organizational skills. He joined the board of directors and was a vice president responsible for... To Read the Full Story Subscribe Sign In
